Records of the Department of Public Speaking: The George Augustus Sandham Oratorical Contest
Sandham, Anna M.
RG.21.18.2
.15 Linear Feet in one folder in a shared manuscript box.
1899-1907 The New York University Department of Public Speaking's George Augustus Sandham Oratorical Contest was established in 1900 by Sandham's sister Anna and awarded to students from either the College of Arts and Pure Science or the College of Engineering. This collection contains letters dating from 1899 to 1907 from Anna M. Sandham to New York University Chancellor Henry Mitchell MacCracken regarding the establishment and subsequent payments to this award. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials transferred from the New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera (MC 334) during processing in 2022; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Arrangement
The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received.
Historical Note
The New York University Department of Public Speaking's George Augustus Sandham Oratorical Contest was established in 1900 by his sister Anna Sandham. This award was given on the basis of excellence in composition and delivery of original orations prepared by seniors and juniors in the College of Arts and Pure Science or the College of Engineering.
Sourced from NYU Catalogue, 1922-1923

Processing Information

Scope and Contents
This collection contains letters dating from 1899 to 1907 related to the New York University Department of Public Speaking's George Augustus Sandham Oratorical Contest. The letters are from Sandham's sister Anna M. Sandham to the New York University Chancellor Henry Mitchell MacCracken regarding the establishment of this award and her subsequent payments.
